availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, merchant. Native of Canada. Married to Cynthia Hagaman Taylor. Father of James Truman Taylor. Married to Mary Ann Fielding O'Conner Taylor in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on October 15, 1860. Animal feed merchant in Louisville in 1860. Household owned six enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Household hired an additional four enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Merchant in partnership with Daniel M. Jones in Jones & Taylor in Louisville in 1861. Merchant in partnership with Victer Oster in Louisville in 1861. Partner with Frank Fielding in F. Fielding & Company in Louisville in 1862. Wholesale merchant in N. B. & Company in Louisville in 1862. Animal feed merchant in Louisville in 1863. Held a contract with the United States to supply animal feed in Louisville from November 1862, to April 1, 1863. Wholesale dealer in N.B. Taylor & Company in Albany County, New York, in 1864 and 1865.
